items.sentence: I don't want to do that, and I don't want you to do that either.
I just wanted to tell you that I'm really sorry for what I said.
I can't accept the invitation because I have another engagement.
I escaped from the fire with nothing but the clothes on my back.
Little did I dream that we would expand our business to the U.S.
You lean on your parents too much. You must be more independent.
Do you know the difference between a microscope and a telescope?
The train was on the point of leaving when I got to the station.
The train was held up for two hours on account of the snowstorm.
At the job interview, I was asked what I made at my current job.
Tom will be singing his favorite hymn at today's church service.
Tom was really surprised when Mary told him she didn't like him.
Tom was on the phone yelling at someone when I entered the room.
Tom is still driving that old truck he got from his grandfather.
Tom is going to go fishing with one of his cousins next weekend.
Tom and three of his cousins went camping together last weekend.
Have you ever stopped to think what might happen if we did that?
Have you ever seen someone dive into the river from this bridge?
Tom won't be able to do that on his own. We'll need to help him.
I've been back for a week, but I'm still suffering from jet lag.
